Description: Alcatel-Lucent S.A. and three of its subsidiaries agreed to pay a combined $92 million penalty to resolve a Foreign Corrupt Practices Act investigation into the worldwide sales practices of Alcatel S.A. prior to its 2006 merger with Lucent Technologies Inc.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 237130: Power and Communication Line and Related Structures Construction
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: An Alcatel-Lucent subsidiary, Lucent Technologies World Services Inc., agreed to pay the United States $4.2 million to settle False Claims Act allegations that it submitted misleading testing certifications to the Army in connection with the design, construction and modernization of Iraq's emergency communications system.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/alcatel-lucent-subsidiary-agrees-pay-us-42-million-settle-false-claims-act-allegations
